Cable Address:
OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER Rockfound, New York
H. MALCOLM GILLETTE, COMPTROLLER
GEORGE E. VAN DYKE, ASSISTANT COMPTROLLER
August 12, 195U
GA H gUUg
Dear Mr, Ausmus:
-In accordance with your letter of August 3, we
are sending our check for $9*970, to the Treasurer of the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters, This
represents payment in full of the above grant for an ex¬
periment in the technique of broadcasting poetry, under
the direction of Mr. Lewis Hill.
The grant is available for a six-month period
beginning July l£, 19!?U, and at its termination, January ll|,
19^5, we shall expect a signed summary statement of receipts
and disbursements, together with a refund of any unexpended
balance under the grant.
Yours very truly.
o-LU-Ly, /
Mr. Graydon Ausmus, President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Box 2002
University, Alabama
LJH
copy to the Treasurer, Mr. Frank E. Schooley
lk Gregory Hall, University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois - with check.
